verses.verse: The praise of an Ode. By David. He who dwelleth under the protection of the Most High shall lodge in the shelter of the God of heaven.
He will say to the Lord, “Thou art my helper: my God is my refuge, I will trust in him.”
Because he will deliver thee from the snare of hunters; and tumultuous accusation;
with his breast will overshadow thee: therefore under his wings thou shalt rest secure. His truth will encompass thee with armour.
Thou shalt not be afraid of the terror by night; nor of the arrow which flieth by day;
of the thing which walketh in darkness; nor of mischance and the demon of noon day.
A thousand may fall at thy side; and ten thousand at thy right hand: but it shall not approach thee.
But thou with thine eyes shalt observe, and see the reward of the wicked.
Because thou, O Lord, my hope; hast made the Most High thy refuge;
no evils shall come upon thee, nor shall a scourge approach thy dwelling.
For he will give his angels a charge concerning thee; to keep thee in all thy ways;
with their hands they shall bear thee up; shouldst thou chance to strike thy foot against a stone.
Upon an asp and a basilisk thou shalt tread: and trample down a lion and a dragon.
(J) Because he trusted in me, I will deliver him: I will protect him because he knew my name.
He will call on me, and I will answer him: I am with him in affliction: I will deliver him and honour him.
With length of days I will satisfy him; and I will shew him my salvation.
